newsitem.title: USA: Computational names Thomas Valunas CFO.
newsitem.headline: Computational names Thomas Valunas CFO.

text.p: Computational Systems Inc said on Monday it named Thomas Valunas as chief financial officer, replacing Bryan Collier, who will stay with the company as vice president of strategic planning.

Valunas, a member of Computational's board of directors, said he still is behind an company earnings forecast on June 2, which said it expected the second quarter to be "slightly" profitable and below analysts' estimates of $0.24 per share.
"We still feel that's where we stand," Valunas said. Computational opened at 12 on Monday, unchanged and close to its yearly low of 11-7/8.
